text: The Dr. Feelgood World Tour was a concert tour by the American glam metal band Mötley Crüe that ran from 1989 to 1990 to support their fifth studio album Dr. Feelgood. The highly successful tour began in West Hollywood, California on October 5, 1989 and ended in Chandler, Arizona on August 5, 1990. Footage of the opening concert in West Hollywood was used for the music video of "Kickstart My Heart". == Set list == #"Kickstart My Heart" #"Red Hot" #"Rattlesnake Shake" #"Too Young to Fall in Love" #"Shout At The Devil" #"Live Wire" #"Same Ol' Situation" #"Slice Of Your Pie" #"Looks That Kill" #"Smokin' In The Boys Room" #"Wild Side" #"Girls, Girls, Girls" #"Home Sweet Home" #"Dr. Feelgood" ;Encore # * "Jailhouse Rock" ;Notes *"She Goes Down" was performed on select dates. *"Don't Go Away Mad (Just Go Away)" and "Time For Change" were only performed outside the United States, except during the concert in Albuquerque. == Tour dates == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! style="width:150px;" |Date ! style="width:150px;" |City ! style="width:150px;" |Country ! style="width:250px;" |Venue ! style="width:180px;" |Attendance ! style="width:150px;" |Revenue |- ! colspan="6" |Leg 1 — North America |- |October 5, 1989 |West Hollywood |United States |Whisky a Go Go | | |- ! colspan="6" |Leg 2 — Europe |- |October 14, 1989 |Essen | rowspan="3" |Germany |Grugahalle | rowspan="18" | rowspan="18" |- |October 15, 1989 ||Frankfurt||Festhalle Frankfurt |- |October 16, 1989 |Munich |Rudi-Sedlmayer-Halle |- |October 18, 1989 ||Milan||Italy||Palatrussardi |- |October 19, 1989 ||Zürich||Switzerland||Hallenstadion |- |October 20, 1989 ||Würzburg||Germany||Carl-Diem-Halle |- |October 22, 1989 ||Copenhagen||Denmark||K.B.
